Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: I've never heard of it before, either

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: They only seem to make source + binary releases and upload that to Github, but not actually use Github directly. It's a bit peculiar and makes it hard to browse their source code (which is written in Java(!)) https://github.com/VeriBlock/nodecore-releases

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: @FishyGuts my guess is that tweeter is not an english native speaker and meant "talk about the two". I don't think either project has communicated with each other

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: I think it's great to see other projects competing with DPoW, it shows that our industry needs a solution to this issue and I still think KMD has the best solution. I will look more into PoP

Author: Gawain#7858
Content: PoP seems like nonsense to me on the first read

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: https://www.veriblock.org/wp-content/uploads/2018/03/PoP-White-Paper.pdf

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: the whitepaper, I have seen worse. But they don't link to any of their own open source code

Author: Gawain#7858
Content: If sub-chains have to compete for longest, what's the point of embedding it into bitcoin chain at all? sub-chains can grow past each other, nothing is gained afaik

Author: Gawain#7858
Content: with notary nodes it's pretty clear, the first commit you see with enough notaries is irreversible for KMD or w/e subchain

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: i would like to know of 1 other coin that is using PoP to protect themselves, and I want to read the code. That doesn't seem to exist yet

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: and it's not clear of VBK itself is protected by BTC hashrate yet

Author: Gawain#7858
Content: yeah white paper seems to use a lot of guessing words like might or may

Author: Gawain#7858
Content: like they don't know how to implement it

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: it's weird to only put releases on Github, like you don't want people to see your commits. Perhaps because they have a private git repo somewhere, but it just doesn't look good and it's not friendly to review

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: I'm not willing to read Java, so please somebody else read the code and let me know 😃

Author: ca333#0118
Content: no offense against java devs or pop, i did java myself for some time - but i think securing your chain with java is like using a teabag as a condom. it just has too much of a risk layer that i would not feel comfortable with recommend anyone. You would really have to fully review the java engine and the java implementation in order to "be sure/safe".

Author: Mylo#8306
Content: make sure the teabag doesn't have a staple.  extra damage.

Author: Mylo#8306
Content: PoP runinng from a mining pool would be interesting from a private mining attack scenario maybe?   interesting in the sense that the "evil" longest chain and PoP miner wins.... 🤷

Author: Mylo#8306
Content: i was led to this thought by a conversation in /r/cryptotechnology a month ago when dPoW was top post in one of those weeks.
